Germany	S-LOC
's	O
Agriculture	B-ORG
Ministry	E-ORG
suggested	O
on	O
Wednesday	O
that	O
consumers	O
avoid	O
eating	O
meat	O
from	O
British	S-MISC
sheep	O
until	O

determine	O
whether	O
mad	O
cow	O

can	O

to	O
the	O
animals	O
.	O

"	O

this	O
is	O

up	O
by	O
the	O
European	B-ORG
Union	E-ORG
's	O
scientific	O

all	O
possible	O

to	O
sheepmeat	O
from	O
other	O
countries	O
,	O
"	O
ministry	O
official	O
Werner	B-PER
Zwingmann	E-PER
told	O
ZDF	S-ORG
television	O
.	O

"	O
I	O
do	O
not	O
want	O
to	O

that	O
there	O
is	O

"	O

in	O
what	O
we	O
know	O
,	O
and	O
these	O
must	O
be	O
filled	O
very	O
quickly	O
.	O
"	O

Bonn	S-LOC
has	O
led	O
efforts	O
to	O
ensure	O
consumer	O
protection	O
tops	O
the	O
list	O
of	O
priorities	O
in	O
dealing	O
with	O
the	O
mad	O
cow	O
crisis	O
,	O
which	O
erupted	O
in	O
March	O
when	O
Britain	S-LOC
acknowledged	O
humans	O
could	O
contract	O
a	O
similar	O
illness	O
by	O
eating	O
contaminated	O
beef	O
.	O

The	O
European	B-ORG
Commission	E-ORG
agreed	O
this	O
month	O
to	O
rethink	O
a	O
proposal	O
to	O
ban	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
suspect	O
sheep	O
tissue	O
after	O
some	O
EU	S-ORG
veterinary	O
experts	O
questioned	O
whether	O
it	O
was	O
justified	O
.	O

EU	S-ORG
Farm	O
Commissioner	O
Franz	B-PER
Fischler	E-PER
had	O
proposed	O
banning	O
sheep	O
brains	O
,	O
spleens	O
and	O
spinal	O
cords	O
from	O
the	O
human	O
and	O
animal	O
food	O
chains	O
after	O
reports	O
from	O
Britain	S-LOC
and	O
France	S-LOC
that	O
under	O
laboratory	O
conditions	O
sheep	O
could	O
contract	O
Bovine	B-MISC
Spongiform	I-MISC
Encephalopathy	E-MISC
(	O
BSE	S-MISC
)	O
--	O
mad	O
cow	O
disease	O
.	O

But	O
some	O
members	O
of	O
the	O
EU	S-ORG
's	O
standing	O
veterinary	O
committee	O
questioned	O
whether	O
the	O
action	O
was	O
necessary	O
given	O
the	O
slight	O
risk	O
to	O
human	O
health	O
.	O

The	O
question	O
is	O
being	O
studied	O
separately	O
by	O
two	O
EU	S-ORG
scientific	O
committees	O
.	O

Sheep	O
have	O
long	O
been	O
known	O
to	O
contract	O
scrapie	O
,	O
a	O
similar	O
brain-wasting	O
disease	O
to	O
BSE	S-MISC
which	O
is	O
believed	O
to	O
have	O
been	O
transferred	O
to	O
cattle	O
through	O
feed	O
containing	O
animal	O
waste	O
.	O

British	S-MISC
officials	O
say	O
sheep	O
meat	O
is	O
perfectly	O
safe	O
to	O
eat	O
.	O

ZDF	S-ORG
said	O
Germany	S-LOC
imported	O
47,600	O
sheep	O
from	O
Britain	S-LOC
last	O
year	O
,	O
nearly	O
half	O
of	O
total	O
imports	O
.	O

It	O
brought	O
in	O
4,275	O
tonnes	O
of	O
British	S-MISC
mutton	O
,	O
some	O
10	O
percent	O
of	O
overall	O
imports	O
.	O

the	O
British	S-MISC
government	O
admitted	O
a	O

disease	O

's	O

.	O

may	O
not	O
lower	O
blood	O
cholesterol	O
and	O
studies	O
that	O
show	O
they	O
do	O
may	O
be	O
flawed	O
,	O
British	S-MISC
researchers	O
have	O
reported	O
.	O

A	O
study	O
by	O
a	O
team	O
of	O
doctors	O
at	O
Oxford	B-ORG
University	E-ORG
has	O
found	O
people	O
with	O
high	O
blood	O
cholesterol	O
do	O
not	O
benefit	O
significantly	O
from	O
taking	O
garlic	O
tablets	O
.	O

The	O
study	O
involved	O
115	O
people	O
with	O
high	O
blood	O
cholesterol	O
levels	O
.	O

They	O
were	O
given	O
900	O
milligrams	O
a	O
day	O
of	O
dried	O
garlic	O
powder	O
or	O
placebo	O
tablets	O
.	O
"	O

There	O
were	O
no	O
significant	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
groups	O
receiving	O
garlic	O
and	O
placebo	O
,	O
"	O
they	O
wrote	O
in	O
the	O
Journal	B-ORG
of	I-ORG
the	I-ORG
Royal	I-ORG
College	I-ORG
of	I-ORG
Physicians	E-ORG
.	O

Those	O
taking	O
part	O
were	O
told	O
to	O
eat	O
a	O
low-fat	O
diet	O
for	O
six	O
weeks	O
before	O
they	O
started	O
taking	O
the	O
pills	O
,	O
and	O
their	O
blood	O
cholesterol	O
measured	O
before	O
and	O
after	O
the	O
six-week	O
period	O
.	O

The	O
researchers	O
said	O
this	O
would	O
make	O
their	O
findings	O
more	O
accurate	O
.	O

Several	O
studies	O
have	O
found	O
garlic	O
pills	O
can	O
lower	O
blood	O
pressure	O
and	O
blood	O
cholesterol	O
.	O

But	O
the	O
Oxford	S-LOC
team	O
disputed	O
these	O
findings	O
and	O
said	O
either	O
previous	O
trials	O
may	O
have	O
been	O
interpreted	O
incorrectly	O
,	O
those	O
taking	O
part	O
were	O
not	O
given	O
special	O
diets	O
beforehand	O
or	O
the	O
duration	O
of	O
the	O
studies	O
may	O
have	O
been	O
too	O
short	O
.	O

The	O
six-month	O
trial	O
was	O
funded	O
by	O
the	O
British	B-ORG
Heart	I-ORG
Foundation	E-ORG
and	O
Lichtwer	B-ORG
Pharma	I-ORG
GmbH	E-ORG
,	O
which	O
makes	O
Kwai	S-MISC
brand	O
garlic	O
tablets	O
.	O

The	O
study	O
did	O
not	O
address	O
whether	O
whole	O
garlic	O
could	O
affect	O
cholesterol	O
.	O

KIEV	S-LOC
1996-08-23	O

Ukraine	S-LOC
celebrates	O
five	O
years	O
of	O
independence	O
from	O
Kremlin	S-LOC
rule	O
on	O
Saturday	O
,	O
hailing	O
civil	O
and	O
inter-ethnic	O
peace	O
as	O
its	O
main	O
post-Soviet	S-MISC
achievement	O
.	O

Ukraine	S-LOC
's	O
declaration	O
of	O
independence	O
in	O
1991	O
,	O
backed	O
nine-to-one	O
by	O
a	O
referendum	O
in	O
December	O
of	O
that	O
year	O
,	O
effectively	O
dealt	O
a	O
death	O
blow	O
to	O
the	O
Soviet	S-MISC
empire	O
and	O
ended	O
more	O
than	O
three	O
centuries	O
of	O
rule	O
from	O
Moscow	S-LOC
.	O

Ukraine	S-LOC
,	O
with	O
a	O
Russian	S-MISC
community	O
of	O
11	O
million	O
people	O
--	O
the	O
world	O
's	O
largest	O
outside	O
Russia	S-LOC
--	O
has	O
avoided	O
conflicts	O
like	O
those	O
in	O
Russia	S-LOC
's	O
Chechnya	S-LOC
,	O
neighbouring	O
Moldova	S-LOC
,	O
and	O
the	O
former	O
Soviet	S-MISC
republics	O
of	O
Georgia	S-LOC
,	O
Azerbaijan	S-LOC
and	O
Tajikistan	S-LOC
.	O

"	O
Ukraine	S-LOC
's	O
biggest	O
achievements	O
for	O
five	O
years	O
are	O
the	O
preservation	O
of	O
civil	O
peace	O
and	O
inter-ethnic	O
harmony	O
,	O
"	O
President	O
Leonid	B-PER
Kuchma	E-PER
said	O
in	O
televised	O
statement	O
this	O
week	O
.	O

"	O
Unlike	O
many	O
other	O
post-Soviet	S-MISC
countries	O
we	O
were	O
able	O
to	O
deal	O
with	O
conflict	O
situations	O
in	O
a	O
peaceful	O
and	O
civilised	O
way	O
.	O
"	O

independence	O
was	O
initially	O

by	O
hyper-inflation	O
and	O
economic	O
collapse	O
,	O
although	O

of	O
a	O

.	O

--	O
a	O

10,300	O
percent	O
a	O

in	O

,	O

$	O
4.9	O

President	O

Yeltsin	E-PER

's	O

Corp	E-ORG

British	S-MISC
hostage	O
in	O
Chechnya	S-LOC
describes	O
ordeal	O
.	O

LONDON	S-LOC
1996-08-24	O

A	O
British	S-MISC
aid	O
worker	O
,	O
held	O
hostage	O
in	O
Chechnya	S-LOC
for	O
nearly	O
four	O
weeks	O
,	O
said	O
on	O
Saturday	O
a	O
cocked	O
Kalashnikov	S-MISC
had	O
been	O
thrust	O
into	O
his	O
mouth	O
at	O
one	O
point	O
during	O
his	O
ordeal	O
.	O

Michael	B-PER
Penrose	E-PER
,	O
a	O
23-year-old	O
worker	O
with	O
the	O
group	O
Action	B-ORG
Against	I-ORG
Hunger	E-ORG
,	O
described	O
his	O
ordeal	O
to	O
a	O
news	O
conference	O
when	O
he	O
arrived	O
back	O
in	O
Britain	S-LOC
from	O
Moscow	S-LOC
.	O

"	O
The	O
worst	O
period	O
of	O
physical	O
manhandling	O
was	O
during	O
that	O
time	O
when	O
we	O
were	O
beaten	O
with	O
Kalashnikovs	S-MISC
and	O
at	O
one	O
point	O
I	O
had	O
a	O
Kalashnikov	S-MISC
held	O
to	O
the	O
back	O
of	O
my	O
throat	O
--	O
cocked	O
,	O
"	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

"	O
For	O
the	O
first	O
period	O
we	O
were	O
held	O
in	O
a	O
small	O
room	O
with	O
no	O
bed	O
or	O
anything	O
.	O

We	O
had	O
very	O
little	O
food	O
and	O
sometimes	O
went	O
two	O
or	O
three	O
days	O
without	O
eating	O
.	O
"	O

Gunmen	O
seized	O
Penrose	S-PER
,	O
who	O
comes	O
from	O
Swerford	S-LOC
in	O
southern	O
England	S-LOC
,	O
Frenchman	S-MISC
Frederic	B-PER
Malardeau	E-PER
and	O
six	O
other	O
hostages	O
from	O
their	O
car	O
in	O
Grozny	S-LOC
,	O
the	O
capital	O
of	O
Chechnya	S-LOC
,	O
on	O
July	O
27	O
.	O

The	O
assailants	O
had	O
demanded	O
a	O
ransom	O
of	O
300,000	O
pounds	O
(	O
$	O
465,000	O
)	O
but	O
no	O
money	O
was	O
paid	O
by	O
the	O
charity	O
when	O
they	O
were	O
released	O
on	O
Wednesday	O
.	O

The	O
hostages	O
were	O
held	O
in	O
a	O
house	O
in	O
or	O
near	O
Grozny	S-LOC
which	O
was	O
bombarded	O
regularly	O
.	O

"	O
During	O
the	O
last	O
15	O
days	O
of	O
being	O
held	O
,	O
the	O
fighting	O
in	O
Grozny	S-LOC
was	O
very	O
close	O
.	O

At	O
first	O
it	O
was	O

Adventurers	O
start	O
Canadian	S-MISC
wilderness	O
race	O
.	O

PEMBERTON	S-LOC
,	O
British	B-LOC
Columbia	E-LOC
1996-08-24	O

About	O
350	O
adventurers	O
from	O
nine	O
countries	O
set	O
out	O
on	O
Saturday	O
to	O
climb	O
,	O
raft	O
,	O
bike	O
and	O
run	O
in	O
a	O
323-mile	O
(	O
517-km	O
)	O
endurance	O
race	O
through	O
the	O
Canadian	S-MISC
wilderness	O
.	O

The	O
event	O
,	O
called	O
the	O
Eco-Challenge	S-MISC
,	O
is	O
part	O
of	O
a	O
growing	O
sport	O
known	O
as	O
adventure	O
racing	O
in	O
which	O
competitors	O
test	O
their	O
limits	O
for	O
days	O
over	O
a	O
perilous	O
wilderness	O
course	O
.	O

"	O
I	O
'm	O
looking	O
forward	O
to	O
this	O
race	O
.	O

I	O
think	O
it	O
will	O
be	O
more	O
physically	O
challenging	O
and	O
we	O
'll	O
have	O
to	O
go	O
up	O
against	O
more	O
diverse	O
situations	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
terrain	O
,	O
"	O
said	O
Dr.	O
Michael	B-PER
Stroud	E-PER
,	O
a	O
veteran	O
Eco-Challenge	S-MISC
participant	O
.	O

The	O
Eco-Challenge	S-MISC
has	O
been	O
staged	O
twice	O
before	O
--	O
in	O
Utah	S-LOC
and	O
Maine	S-LOC
last	O
year	O
--	O
and	O
is	O
modelled	O
on	O
similar	O
races	O
overseas	O
.	O

The	O
70	O
teams	O
in	O
this	O
year	O
's	O
race	O
will	O
will	O
trek	O
glaciers	O
,	O
climb	O
mountains	O
,	O
whitewater	O
raft	O
,	O
horseback	O
ride	O
,	O
canoe	O
and	O
mountain	O
bike	O
along	O
the	O
grueling	O
course	O
.	O

This	O
year	O
's	O
race	O
,	O
the	O
route	O
of	O
which	O
was	O
keep	O
a	O
secret	O
until	O
Friday	O
evening	O
,	O
is	O
being	O
held	O
near	O
Pemberton	S-LOC
,	O
British	B-LOC
Columbia	E-LOC
,	O
about	O
100	O
miles	O
(	O
160	O
km	O
)	O
northeast	O
of	O
Vancouver	S-LOC
.	O

The	O
area	O
is	O
filled	O
with	O
treacherous	O
mountain	O
peaks	O
,	O
ice	O
fields	O
and	O
frigid	O
waters	O
.	O

Organisers	O
expect	O

of	O
the	O
participants	O
to	O

out	O
or	O

.	O

The	O

are	O

to	O
complete	O
the	O
course	O
in	O
about	O
six	O
days	O
,	O
with	O
first-place	O

receiving	O
$	O
10,000	O
in	O
prize	O
money	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
Eco-Challenge	S-MISC
,	O
competitors	O
race	O
in	O
teams	O
of	O
five	O
which	O
must	O
include	O
both	O
men	O
and	O
women	O
.	O

Team	O
members	O
must	O
remain	O
within	O
100	O
yards	O
(	O
metres	O
)	O
of	O
each	O
other	O
at	O
all	O
times	O
and	O
finish	O
together	O
.	O

racers	O
carrying	O
about	O
40	O
pounds	O
(	O
18	O
kg	O
)	O
of	O
gear	O
on	O
their	O
backs	O
,	O
broken	O
bones	O
,	O
sunstroke	O
,	O
dehydration	O
and	O
exhaustion	O
are	O
common	O
.	O

fund	O
startups	O
developing	O
Java	S-MISC
technologies	O
.	O

Java	S-MISC
has	O
been	O
licensed	O
by	O
nearly	O
50	O
organisations	O
,	O
ranging	O
from	O
Microsoft	B-ORG
Corp.	E-ORG
and	O
International	B-ORG
Business	I-ORG
Machines	I-ORG
Corp.	E-ORG
to	O
the	O
Taiwan	S-LOC
government	O
.	O

Prasad	B-PER
Wagle	E-PER
,	O
another	O
former	O
senior	O
JavaSoft	S-ORG
engineer	O
who	O
is	O
among	O
the	O
founding	O
engineers	O
at	O
Internet	B-ORG
Startup	E-ORG
,	O
said	O
the	O
new	O
company	O
aims	O
to	O
build	O
software	O
infrastructure	O
using	O
Java	S-MISC
to	O
make	O
networked	O
applications	O
ubiquitious	O
.	O

One	O
feature	O
of	O
the	O
Java	S-MISC
language	O
is	O
that	O
small	O
software	O
programmes	O
,	O
known	O
as	O
"	O
applets	O
"	O
because	O
they	O
are	O
small	O
applications	O
,	O
can	O
be	O
downloaded	O
from	O
the	O
server	O
computers	O
at	O
the	O
centre	O
of	O
networks	O
onto	O
individual	O
computers	O
for	O
use	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
model	O
,	O
individual	O
computer	O
users	O
can	O
always	O
gain	O
access	O
to	O
the	O
latest	O
programmes	O
and	O
do	O
not	O
need	O
to	O
store	O
more	O
software	O
than	O
they	O
are	O
currently	O
using	O
on	O
their	O
computers	O
at	O
any	O
one	O
time	O
,	O
also	O
saving	O
costs	O
of	O
memory	O
and	O
storage	O
.	O

Chris	B-PER
Zuleeg	E-PER
,	O
a	O
veteran	O
of	O
Apple	S-ORG
and	O
a	O
former	O
JavaSoft	S-ORG
marketing	O
manager	O
,	O
is	O
vice	O
president	O
of	O
marketing	O
at	O
Internet	B-ORG
Startup	E-ORG
,	O

.	O

AND	O
ENGLAND	S-LOC
SLIM	O
SATISFACTION	O
.	O

LONDON	S-LOC
1996-08-25	O

Chris	B-PER
Lewis	E-PER
did	O
his	O
best	O
to	O

his	O

from	O
the	O
England	S-LOC

the	O

at	O

Oval	E-LOC
.	O

super	O

of	O
fielding	O
by	O
Lewis	S-PER

a	O

provided	O

only	O

for	O
England	S-LOC
as	O

413	O
for	O

a	O

of	O
87	O
.	O

solitary	O

to	O

was	O

Mujtaba	E-PER
,	O
run	O
out	O
for	O
13	O
attempting	O
a	O
second	O

to	O
third	O
man	O
where	O
Lewis	S-PER
was	O

a	O

to	O
prove	O
.	O

seemed	O

until	O
the	O

player	O

to	O
county	O
team	O

Alec	B-PER
Stewart	E-PER
who	O

Corporate	O

is	O

.	O

Next	O

,	O

.	O

.	O
"	O

II	E-MISC
,	O

"	O

"	O

,	O
"	O

.	O

.	O

"	O

,	O
"	O

.	O
"	O

.	O

'	O

results	O
?	O
'	O

"	O

Brian	B-PER

RIO	B-LOC
DE	I-LOC
JANEIRO	E-LOC
1996-08-26	O

1996-08-26	O

Lamonts	B-ORG
Apparel	I-ORG
Inc	E-ORG
,	O
an	O
operator	O
of	O
42	O
family	O
apparel	O
stores	O
in	O
six	O
northwestern	O
states	O
,	O
said	O
it	O
has	O
filed	O
a	O
reorganization	O
plan	O
in	O
bankruptcy	O
court	O
in	O
Seattle	S-LOC
.	O

(	O
Corrects	O
to	O
make	O
clear	O
a	O
reorganization	O
plan	O
has	O
been	O
filed	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
reorganization	O
plan	O
calls	O
for	O
all	O
secured	O
claims	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
in	O
full	O
.	O

Unsecured	O
claims	O
,	O
including	O
those	O
of	O
company	O
bondholders	O
,	O
will	O
be	O
satisfied	O
by	O
issuing	O
new	O
common	O
stock	O
and	O
warrants	O
.	O

Unsecured	O
claims	O
are	O
estimated	O
at	O
about	O
$	O
90	O
million	O
.	O

Lamonts	S-ORG
said	O
it	O
plans	O
to	O
issue	O
9	O
million	O
shares	O
of	O
new	O
common	O
stock	O
.	O

Of	O
that	O
amount	O
,	O
4.05	O
million	O
and	O
5.67	O
million	O
shares	O
will	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
the	O
company	O
's	O
trade	O
creditors	O
.	O

Between	O
4.75	O
and	O
3.13	O
million	O
shares	O
will	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
bondholders	O
and	O
other	O
unsecured	O
non-trade	O
creditors	O
and	O
200,000	O
will	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
existing	O
shareholders	O
in	O
exchange	O

all	O
existing	O
stock	O
of	O
the	O
company	O
.	O

Bondholders	O
and	O
other	O
unsecured	O
non-trade	O
creditors	O
will	O
receive	O
warrants	O
four	O
about	O
2.2	O
million	O
shares	O
when	O
the	O

market	O
capitalization	O
reaches	O
$	O
20	O
million	O
.	O

,	O
other	O
unsecured	O
non-trade	O
creditors	O
,	O

existing	O

on	O
Monday	O

soon	O
after	O

Guernsey	S-LOC
in	O
Britain	S-LOC
's	O
Channel	B-LOC
Islands	E-LOC
,	O

said	O

said	O

and	O
six	O

on	O
board	O
the	O
ferry	O
Trident	B-MISC

,	O
owned	O
by	O
France	S-LOC
's	O
Emeraud	S-ORG
line	O

were	O
rescued	O
by	O
a	O

of	O
private	O
and	O
commercial	O
boats	O
after	O
fire	O
broke	O
out	O
in	O
the	O
engine	O
room	O
soon	O
after	O
it	O
left	O
port	O
.	O

to	O

of	O

on	O

.	O

from	O
the	O
Organisation	B-ORG
for	I-ORG
Security	I-ORG
and	I-ORG
Cooperation	I-ORG
in	I-ORG

(	O
OSCE	S-ORG
)	O
are	O

the	O

of	O

in	O

.	O

"	O

...	O

on	O
September	O
14	O
,	O
"	O
OSCE	S-ORG

Kuperman	E-PER
told	O

.	O

"	O

that	O

)	O

probably	O

all	O

..	O

.	O
"	O

Kuperman	S-PER
added	O
that	O
options	O
other	O
than	O
postponement	O
were	O
also	O
on	O
the	O
table	O
,	O
but	O
she	O
refused	O
to	O
specify	O
what	O
they	O
were	O
.	O

The	O
Dayton	S-LOC
peace	O
agreement	O
gave	O
the	O
OSCE	S-ORG
a	O
mandate	O
to	O
organise	O
Bosnian	S-MISC
elections	O
.	O

The	O
Provisional	B-ORG
Election	I-ORG
Commission	E-ORG
is	O
OSCE	S-ORG
's	O
top	O
rule-making	O
body	O
for	O
the	O
poll	O
.	O

More	O
than	O
600,000	O
refugees	O
have	O
registered	O
to	O
vote	O
in	O
55	O
countries	O
around	O
the	O
world	O
,	O
representing	O
about	O
20	O
per	O
cent	O
of	O
Bosnia	S-LOC
's	O
total	O
electorate	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
due	O
to	O
begin	O
voting	O
on	O
Wednesday	O
,	O
August	O
28	O
,	O
just	O
one	O
day	O
after	O
the	O
PEC	S-ORG
is	O
supposed	O
to	O
make	O
its	O
decision	O
.	O

inside	O
Bosnia	S-LOC
is	O
scheduled	O
for	O
September	O
14	O
,	O
when	O
citizens	O
are	O
slated	O
to	O
elect	O
municipal	O
and	O

assemblies	O
,	O
separate	O
Moslem-Croat	S-MISC
and	O
Serb	S-MISC
parliaments	O
,	O
a	O
national	O
House	B-ORG
of	I-ORG
Representatives	E-ORG
and	O
a	O
three-man	O
Presidency	O
.	O

A	O
Sarajevo	S-LOC
daily	O
newspaper	O
,	O
Dnevi	B-ORG
Avaz	E-ORG
,	O
which	O
is	O
close	O
to	O
Bosnia	S-LOC
's	O
Moslem	S-MISC
nationalist	O
SDA	S-ORG
party	O
,	O
on	O
Monday	O
said	O
the	O
OSCE	S-ORG
would	O
postpone	O
the	O
municipal-level	O
elections	O
until	O
the	O
Spring	O
of	O
1997	O
because	O
of	O
the	O
refugee	O
registration	O
problems	O
.	O

SDA	S-ORG
has	O
a	O
representative	O
on	O
the	O
Provisional	B-ORG
Election	I-ORG
Commission	E-ORG
.	O

"	O
I	O
do	O
n't	O
know	O
what	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
Dnevi	B-ORG
Avaz	E-ORG
report	O
is	O
,	O
but	O

is	O

BUENOS	B-LOC

Alejandro	B-PER
Lanusse	E-PER
,	O

former	O

who	O

78	O

.	O

Lanusse	S-PER
died	O
after	O
being	O
brought	O
to	O
a	O
hospital	O
a	O
week	O
ago	O
following	O
a	O
fall	O
at	O
home	O
that	O
resulted	O
in	O
a	O
blood	O
clot	O
in	O
the	O
brain	O
.	O

was	O
operated	O
on	O
earlier	O
in	O
the	O
week	O
but	O
failed	O
to	O
recover	O
from	O
surgery	O
.	O

The	O
former	O
dictator	O
,	O
who	O
ruled	O
from	O
1971	O
to	O
1973	O
,	O
was	O
best	O
known	O
for	O

Juan	B-PER
Domingo	I-PER
Peron	E-PER
,	O
Argentina	S-LOC
's	O
famed	O
populist	O
leader	O
,	O
to	O
return	O
to	O
Argentina	S-LOC
after	O
17	O
years	O
of	O
forced	O
exile	O
.	O

Lanusse	S-PER
took	O
over	O
the	O
leadership	O
of	O
the	O
country	O
after	O
five	O
years	O
of	O
dictatorship	O
.	O

But	O
unlike	O
his	O
two	O
predecessors	O
,	O
Juan	B-PER
Carlos	E-PER
Ongania	O
and	O
Marcelo	B-PER
Levingston	E-PER
,	O
who	O
ruled	O
Argentina	S-LOC
with	O
an	O
iron	O
hand	O
,	O
Lanusse	S-PER
steered	O
the	O
country	O
toward	O
democracy	O
.	O

That	O
resulted	O
in	O
general	O
elections	O
in	O
March	O
1973	O
when	O
the	O
Peronists	S-ORG
led	O
by	O
Hector	B-PER
Campora	E-PER
and	O
Vicente	B-PER
Solano	I-PER
Lima	E-PER
returned	O
to	O
power	O
.	O

Lanusse	S-PER
was	O
a	O
candidate	O
in	O
the	O
election	O
but	O
failed	O
to	O
defeat	O
his	O
old	O
adversories	O
and	O
never	O
returned	O
to	O
public	O
office	O
.	O

He	O
was	O
imprisoned	O
for	O
four	O
years	O
in	O
1951	O
for	O
taking	O
part	O
in	O
a	O

KATHMANDU	S-LOC
1996-08-27	O

Nepal	S-LOC
's	O
centre-right	O
coalition	O
government	O

offered	O
to	O
meet	O
the	O
country	O
's	O
hardline	O
Maoist	S-MISC
communists	O

in	O
a	O

to	O

in	O

's	O

said	O
on	O
Tuesday	O
.	O

oppose	O

-DOCSTART-	O

SEC	S-ORG
adopts	O
rules	O
to	O
improve	O
investor	O
access	O
to	O
best	O
stock	O
prices	O
.	O

WASHINGTON	S-LOC
1996-08-28	O

The	O
Securities	B-ORG
and	I-ORG
Exchange	I-ORG
Commission	E-ORG
Wednesday	O
approved	O
rules	O
designed	O
to	O
give	O
stock	O
market	O
investors	O
a	O
better	O
chance	O
at	O
getting	O
the	O
best	O
price	O
available	O
for	O
their	O
orders	O
.	O

The	O
so-called	O
order	O
handling	O
rules	O
,	O
which	O
were	O
proposed	O
last	O
September	O
,	O
were	O
approved	O
in	O
a	O
4-0	O
vote	O
.	O

The	O
new	O
rules	O
will	O
require	O
specialists	O
at	O
stock	O
exchanges	O
and	O
market	O
makers	O
on	O
Nasdaq	S-MISC
to	O
allow	O
customers	O
to	O
view	O
price	O
quotes	O
from	O
other	O
electronic	O
trading	O
systems	O
that	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
readily	O
available	O
to	O
them	O
.	O

The	O
rules	O
will	O
also	O
require	O
that	O
customer	O
limit	O
orders	O
be	O
displayed	O
with	O
prices	O
better	O
than	O
those	O
available	O
in	O
quotes	O
publicly	O
available	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
.	O

Specialists	O
and	O
market	O
makers	O
are	O
companies	O
or	O
individuals	O
recognised	O
as	O
qualified	O
to	O
maintain	O
an	O
orderly	O
market	O
in	O
a	O
stock	O
.	O

In	O
a	O
limit	O
order	O
,	O
investors	O
specify	O
the	O
price	O
at	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
willing	O
to	O
buy	O
or	O
sell	O
,	O
as	O
opposed	O
to	O
a	O
market	O
order	O
executed	O
at	O
prevailing	O
prices	O
.	O

"	O
These	O
rules	O
are	O
intended	O
to	O
empower	O
all	O
investors	O
,	O
by	O
allowing	O
their	O
orders	O
to	O
compete	O
on	O
a	O
level	O
playing	O
field	O
,	O
and	O
by	O
providing	O
the	O
disclosure	O
they	O
need	O
to	O
make	O
informed	O
decisions	O
,	O
"	O
said	O
SEC	S-ORG
Chairman	O
Arthur	B-PER
Levitt	E-PER
.	O

The	O
SEC	S-ORG
's	O
goal	O
,	O
he	O
added	O
,	O
was	O
to	O
create	O
"	O
one	O
system	O
where	O
one	O
price	O
could	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
everybody	O
.	O
"	O

The	O
director	O
of	O
the	O
SEC	S-ORG
's	O
division	O
of	O
market	O
regulation	O
,	O
Richard	B-PER
Lindsey	E-PER
,	O
said	O
Wall	B-LOC
Street	E-LOC
firms	O
will	O
probably	O
need	O
to	O
spend	O
about	O
$	O
7	O
million	O
to	O
carry	O
out	O
the	O
improvements	O
called	O
for	O
by	O
the	O
new	O
rules	O
.	O

In	O
proposing	O
the	O
rules	O
last	O
year	O
,	O
the	O
SEC	S-ORG
noted	O
that	O
while	O
technology	O
has	O
improved	O
,	O
commonplace	O
practices	O
still	O
existed	O
that	O
worked	O
against	O
investors	O
'	O
best	O
interests	O
.	O

It	O
noted	O
that	O
customers	O
whose	O
orders	O
were	O
not	O
displayed	O
lost	O
the	O
chance	O
of	O
getting	O
the	O
best	O
possible	O
price	O
available	O
in	O
the	O
market	O
.	O

It	O
also	O
cited	O
the	O
potential	O
problem	O
of	O
a	O
two-tiered	O
market	O
in	O
which	O
market	O
makers	O
quote	O
one	O
price	O
to	O
public	O
investors	O
while	O
quoting	O
better	O
prices	O
in	O
private	O
systems	O
,	O
thus	O
robbing	O
investors	O
without	O
access	O
to	O
"	O
hidden	O
"	O
quotes	O
the	O
benefit	O
of	O
the	O
best	O
available	O
prices	O
.	O

Earlier	O
this	O
month	O
,	O
the	O
SEC	S-ORG
settled	O
charges	O
of	O
alleged	O
malpractices	O
on	O
Nasdaq	S-MISC
when	O
the	O
parent	O
of	O
the	O
Nasdaq	S-MISC
market	O
,	O
the	O
National	B-ORG
Association	I-ORG
of	I-ORG

,	O

to	O

100	O
million	O
over	O
five	O
years	O
to	O
upgrade	O
its	O
oversight	O
of	O
brokers	O
'	O
trading	O
practices	O
.	O

The	O
SEC	S-ORG
dropped	O
a	O
third	O
proposal	O
that	O
would	O
have	O
allowed	O
investors	O

"	O

.	O

.	O

National	B-ORG

and	O

F.W.	B-PER
De	I-PER

in	O

the	O
commission	O
has	O
been	O
hearing	O

winner	O

Desmond	B-PER

.	O

Allen	S-PER

Wednesday	O

First	B-ORG

settles	O
suit	O
.	O

JACKSONVILLE	S-LOC
,	O
Fla.	S-LOC
1996-08-28	O

First	B-ORG
Union	I-ORG
National	I-ORG
Bank	I-ORG
of	I-ORG
Florida	E-ORG
said	O
on	O
Wednesday	O
it	O
agreed	O
to	O

a	O
class	O
action	O
law	O
suit	O

its	O

(	O
CPI	S-MISC
)	O
program	O
.	O

for	O

First	B-ORG
Union	E-ORG
has	O

of	O
$	O
4.7	O

for	O
cash	O
refunds	O
and	O
$	O
19.4	O
million	O
in	O

refunds	O
for	O

CPI	S-MISC
balances	O
.	O

of	O
First	B-ORG
Union	I-ORG
Corp	E-ORG
.	O

The	O
bank	O

from	O

from	O

that	O
were	O

in	O

.	O

said	O

has	O
discontinued	O
CPI	S-MISC
as	O
an	O

of	O
its	O

.	O

.	O

world	O
's	O
biggest	O
tomato	O
fight	O
began	O
in	O
the	O
eastern	O
Spanish	S-MISC
village	O
of	O
Bunol	S-LOC
.	O

Thousands	O
of	O
people	O
pelted	O
each	O
other	O
with	O
armfuls	O
of	O
ripe	O
tomatoes	O
as	O
streets	O
,	O
walls	O
and	O
windows	O
were	O
coated	O
in	O
a	O
blood-red	O
wash	O
.	O

A	O
single	O
firework	O
after	O
midday	O
signalled	O
the	O
start	O
of	O
the	O
fruit-throwing	O
frenzy	O
,	O
during	O
which	O
participants	O
hurl	O
some	O
100	O
tonnes	O
of	O
tomatoes	O
trucked	O
in	O
for	O
the	O
occasion	O
.	O

Local	O
historians	O
say	O
the	O
tradition	O
began	O
in	O
1945	O
when	O
disgruntled	O
locals	O
began	O
spontaneously	O
to	O
bombard	O
the	O
priest	O
and	O
mayor	O
at	O
the	O
annual	O
fiesta	O
in	O
Bunol	S-LOC
(	O
pronounced	O
Boo-nee-OL	S-LOC
)	O
.	O

festival	O
's	O
fame	O
has	O
grown	O
and	O
now	O

between	O
15,000	O
and	O
20,000	O
people	O
,	O
many	O
of	O
them	O
foreigners	O

of	O

cases	O
,	O
"	O
Kiely	S-PER

-DOCSTART-	O

Researchers	O
report	O
progress	O
in	O
muscular	O
dystrophy	O
.	O

PHILADELPHIA	S-LOC
1996-08-29	O

University	B-ORG
of	I-ORG
Pennsylvania	E-ORG
researchers	O
on	O
Thursday	O
said	O
a	O
new	O
gene-therapy	O
technique	O
for	O
treating	O
muscular	O
dystrophy	O
disease	O
had	O
shown	O
progress	O
in	O
laboratory	O
animals	O
.	O

Word	O
of	O
the	O
findings	O
,	O
to	O
be	O
published	O
in	O
the	O
Oct.	O
1	O
issue	O
of	O
the	O
journal	O
"	O
Human	B-ORG
Gene	I-ORG
Therapy	E-ORG
,	O
"	O
came	O
in	O
advance	O
of	O
the	O
annual	O
Jerry	B-MISC
Lewis	I-MISC
Labour	I-MISC
Day	E-MISC
weekend	O
telethon	O
to	O
raise	O
money	O
for	O
muscular	O
dystrophy	O
research	O
.	O

Several	O
hurdles	O
must	O
be	O
overcome	O
before	O
the	O
method	O
is	O
used	O
in	O
human	O
trials	O
.	O

Nevertheless	O
,	O
"	O
a	O
treatment	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
new	O
strategy	O
....	O
may	O
have	O
the	O
potential	O
to	O
benefit	O
many	O
patients	O
,	O
"	O
the	O
University	B-ORG
of	I-ORG
Pennsylvania	E-ORG
Medical	O
Centre	O
said	O
in	O
a	O
release	O
.	O

Muscular	O
dystrophy	O
is	O
a	O
fatal	O
illness	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
body	O
's	O
muscle	O
tissue	O
degenerates	O
and	O
is	O
replaced	O
by	O
fat	O
.	O

Death	O
strikes	O
in	O
early	O
adulthood	O
.	O

Individuals	O
with	O
the	O
disease	O
have	O
a	O
non-working	O
version	O
of	O
a	O
gene	O
responsible	O
for	O
producing	O
a	O
crucial	O
muscle	O
protein	O
called	O
dystrophin	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
study	O
at	O
the	O
University	O
's	O
Institute	B-ORG
for	I-ORG
Human	I-ORG
Gene	I-ORG
Therapy	E-ORG
,	O
researchers	O
altered	O
a	O
common-cold	O
virus	O
to	O
carry	O
a	O
version	O
of	O
the	O
working	O
dystrophin	O
gene	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
,	O
which	O
also	O
was	O
altered	O
to	O
minimise	O
its	O
susceptibility	O
to	O
the	O
immune	O
system	O
,	O
was	O
then	O
injected	O
into	O
the	O
muscle	O
cells	O
of	O
mice	O
bred	O
to	O
lack	O
dystrophin	O
genes	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
experiment	O
,	O
between	O
30	O
to	O
40	O
percent	O
of	O
the	O
muscle	O
fibers	O
in	O
one	O
group	O
of	O
mice	O
produced	O
dystrophin	O
for	O
two	O
weeks	O
before	O
diminishing	O
.	O

Similar	O
results	O
had	O
been	O
obtained	O
previously	O
in	O
test-tube	O
cell	O
cultures	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
in	O
live	O
animals	O
,	O
the	O
university	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
university	O
said	O
methods	O
are	O
still	O
needed	O
to	O
make	O
enough	O
of	O
the	O
altered	O
virus	O
to	O
treat	O
humans	O
,	O
to	O
further	O
decrease	O
the	O
immune-system	O
response	O
to	O
the	O
virus	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
deliver	O
the	O
virus	O
to	O
human	O
muscle	O
tissue	O
.	O

(	O

)	O
away	O
from	O
her	O

and	O

,	O
which	O

for	O

earlier	O
this	O
